bibl.title: A Personal Name in a Jar-Inscription in Hebrew Characters from Alexandria?
bibl.note: The letters on the amphora fragment from Alexandria found in 1976 [ed.: Zbigniew T. FIEMA, A Hebrew Inscription from Kom el-Dikka, Alexandria, Egypt, JARCE 22 (1985) pp. 117-118, 1 fig.] (1st cent. B.C.-1st cent. A.D.) should be transcribed brks, and read as the name Βαροῦχος, the Hellenized form of Baruch.
bibl.seg: HORBURY William, A Personal Name in a Jar-Inscription in Hebrew Characters from Alexandria?

The letters on the amphora fragment from Alexandria found in 1976 [ed.: Zbigniew T. FIEMA, A Hebrew Inscription from Kom el-Dikka, Alexandria, Egypt, JARCE 22 (1985) pp. 117-118, 1 fig.] (1st cent. B.C.-1st cent. A.D.) should be transcribed brks, and read as the name Βαροῦχος, the Hellenized form of Baruch.
